title: Internal compiler error in `rustc_resolve` when generating documentation

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.

http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/

-->

When docs.rs [builds documentation for version 0.4.0 of the `turbojpeg` crate][crash], rustc (rustc 1.62.0-nightly (306ba8357 2022-04-05)) crashes:
```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code', compiler/rustc_resolve/src/lib.rs:3302:67
```

[crash]: https://docs.rs/crate/turbojpeg/0.4.0/builds/537741

I managed to reduce the issue to a [single line of code][gist]:
```rust
//! [::image::ImageBuffer]
```

[gist]: https://gist.github.com/honzasp/8897401bc9a1452b18abe0d86a94b861

### Reproducing

To reproduce the full issue, you can clone [the turbojpeg repo][repo] and run:

    rustup run nightly -- cargo doc --open

(you can pass `--features image` to `cargo doc` to get rid of the "unresolved link" warnings; the crash happens in both cases)

[repo]: https://github.com/honzasp/rust-turbojpeg

### Meta

I can reproduce the same issue locally with the nightly compiler (rustc 1.62.0-nightly (306ba8357 2022-04-05)), but not with the stable compiler (rustc 1.59.0 (9d1b2106e 2022-02-23)).

### Error output

For the full backtrace, please see [the build report on docs.rs][crash].
